content: this is a written pattern only posted in case anybody else has a kid in their life clamoring for a home for their stuffies i ve never posted a pattern before so apologies that it s kind of seat-of-the-pants the pattern explains the basics of how to make the pouf which may be all you need if you ve got experience crocheting circles plus the pattern written out in traditional form and a form that i find easier to follow eta a couple pointers 1 wool-ease wow is on the splitty side so if you re planning to use the wrong side of your work as the outside of the pouf keep an eye on it to make sure there aren t stray loops sticking out 2 you can do your increases wherever you want as long as they re more or less evenly spaced but if you re consistently doing them on the last stitch of the repeat each increase will go in the second stitch of the previous row s increase which makes it easier to keep track of and also gives a subtle swirl pattern to the bottom non-buttoned side of the pouf
